basics.name: Alison Tomooka
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Economics and a minor in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I am expected to graduate in Spring 2022, with plans for a Post-Graduate degree.

education.area: Economics with minor in Computer Science (expected Spring, 2022)

work.summary: Provide high level of customer service, sales support, and cashiering assistance. Assist with various store operations.
highlights: Experience with customer service and cashiering
Use of wide-format and direct-to-garment printers

volunteer.organization: Key Club International: Castle High School
highlights: Take minutes at all board and general membership meetings
Submit monthly reports of club activities and service hours

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: The MƒÅnoa Academic Merit Scholarship is an automatic scholarship for four years of undergraduate study. This scholarship is for first-time, degree-seeking students who enroll the semester after high school graduation.
